result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Lavangelo J Fields

defendant.name: Fields, Lavangelo J
defendant.address: 3619 Gas Light Curve Apt 3B, Montgomery, AL 36116

records.addlTxt: Cash bail previously posted to be refunded to poster. Defendant is ordered to contact to the Criminal Traffic Division and have a sign copy of bond back by October 27, 2022 to sign their bond.  Failure to do so shall result in the Court issuing a bench warrant.

9:57 AM Defendant Lavangelo J Fields appeared by Zoom.  Attorney Alyssa M Jay in court for State of Wisconsin. All parties have agreed that some may have the hearing conducted remotely. This hearing has met the statutory standards for video conferencing. 

Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint. 
Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties. 
Court advises of right to an attorney. 
NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED BY COURT.
Hearing scheduled for November 28, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Defendant's returned copy of summons filed by District Attorney's office.
Letter from Defendant requesting Zoom**Reviewed by Commissioner Daniel Rieck on 10/11 "Approved for THAT HEARING ONLY"
State's Demand for Discovery and Inspection and Notice of Intent to Use Defendant's Statement and DNA Evidence.
